title: AI Coding Tools in 2025: Welcome to the Agentic CLI Era
description: 2025 marked the start of the 'Agentic Era' in software development, moving beyond simple IDE chatbots to agentic CLIs. The article explains how AI agents work (LLM + loop + tokens), key use cases like data transformation and code fixes, the evolution from IDE chatbots to agentic CLIs, the importance of Model Context Protocol (MCP) as a universal connector, and the rise of parallel runners in agentic workflows.
author: David Eastman

title: AI Coding Tools I Use to Ship Faster â€“ June 2025
description: A detailed breakdown of a production AI tool stack including ChatGPT for ideation and research, Cursor as primary IDE with 'auto' mode, Claude Code for codebase scanning and documentation, and GitHub Copilot for PR reviews. Emphasizes that 'shipping fixes everything' and speed is more important than perfect code. Provides realistic cost breakdown: $50/month base costs plus $80-120/month usage fees for advanced features.
author: Josh Sherman

title: Vibe Coding 2025: The Complete Guide to AI-Augmented Development
description: Comprehensive guide covering AI-augmented development in 2025, featuring Cursor IDE as a 'Vibe Coding Pioneer' with tiered AI development platforms. Covers the emergence of vibe coding as a significant trend in AI development, with Cursor IDE positioned as a pioneering platform and Claude Code as a leading tool in this space.
author: Various Contributors

title: New Advanced Cursor Rule Framework for Autonomous Coding
description: Details about a newly released framework for AI-assisted development consistency with Cursor IDE, specifically mentioning 'Vibe Coding' applications. The framework aims to standardize AI-assisted development approaches and improve consistency in autonomous coding workflows.
author: Cursor Team

title: Claude Code Review 2025 - Enterprise AI Development Tools
description: Comprehensive comparison between Claude Code and Cursor IDE, positioned as part of the 'vibe coding' ecosystem for 2025. Focuses on enterprise AI development tools and compares features, performance, and use cases for professional development workflows.
author: Vibe Coding Hub

title: Community Insights: Claude Code Performance and Enterprise Adoption
description: Reddit and Hacker News discussions reveal Claude 4.5 completing continuous coding for over 30 hours without stopping. Heavy users spending $70K+ per year on Claude Code report switching to codex CLI for better performance on large software projects. Developers report AI coding transitioned from 'novelty to actually useful' with Claude Code Sonnet 4.
author: Developer Community

title: The Design Space of LLM-Based AI Coding Assistants
description: Academic research paper analyzing 90+ generative AI coding tools. Provides comprehensive analysis of the current AI coding tool landscape, categorization frameworks, and design patterns for effective AI-assisted development environments.
author: UC San Diego Researchers
